main_definition: Being resistant to a particular disease, harmful effect or influence; protected from it.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not affected by something that would affect others, such as a virus or illness.
meanings_and_examples.example: After receiving the vaccine, she was immune to the flu.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not influenced or swayed by particular factors or arguments.
meanings_and_examples.example: His opinions are so well-formed that he is immune to peer pressure.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Prepared in advance for a specific event, especially an unpleasant one; protected from harm or danger.
meanings_and_examples.example: She was immune to the stress of public speaking because she had given many presentations before.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not affected by criticism or other negative feedback.
meanings_and_examples.example: His confidence is so high that he remains immune to any harsh critique.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Unable to be altered, changed, or influenced; stable and constant.
meanings_and_examples.example: Their partnership remained strong because they were immune to the ups and downs of life.
